urbit@urbit.org

sigwut

~?, sigwut, [%sgwt p=@ud q=twig r=twig s=twig] is a synthetic hoon with the same hint effect, printing r, as [%sgpm p r s], iff q produces yes.

Definition

++  twig  
  $%  [%sgwt p=@ud q=twig r=twig s=twig]
  ==

Regular form (tall)

Priority 0 (debug):

~&  q
r

Priority 1 (notice):

~&  >  q
r

Priority 2 (warning):

~&  >>  q
r

Priority 3 (alarm):

~&  >>>  q
r

Regular form (wide)

~&(>> q r)

Expansion

++  open
  ^-  twig
  ?-    gen
      [%sgwt *]
    [%tsgl s.gen %wtdt q.gen [~ 1] %sgpm p.gen r.gen [~ 1]]
  ==

Notes

We often want to print a value for debugging, but it's also easy to be overwhelmed with unconditional printfs.
